info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 4:29PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Polk County through 500 PM CDT... At 429 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Opal, or 10 miles east of Mena, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Opal... Shady... Big Fork... Board Camp... Cherry Hill in Polk County... Ink... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
